Include correctly labeled diagrams, if useful or required, in explaining your answers. A correctly labeled diagram must have all axes and curves clearly labeled and must show directional changes. If the question prompts you to “Calculate,” you must show how you arrived at your final answer.

Suppose a good is produced in a perfectly competitive market. In this market the marginal social benefit (<math alttext="M S B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MSB</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) exceeds the marginal private benefit (<math alttext="M P B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPB</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) at every quantity. The marginal social cost (<math alttext="M S C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MSC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) equals the marginal private cost (<math alttext="M P C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>) at every quantity.

(a) Draw a correctly labeled graph of the <math alttext="M S B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MSB</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="M P B" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPB</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="M S C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MSC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="M P C" overflow="scroll"><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mtext>MPC</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> curves and show each of the following.

(i) The market equilibrium quantity, labeled <math alttext="Q sub M" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>M</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

(ii) The socially optimal quantity, labeled <math alttext="Q sub S" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>Q</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>S</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math>

(iii) The deadweight loss at the market equilibrium, shaded completely

(b) Suppose the government is considering two proposals to make consumers internalize the consumption externality.

• Proposal <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>: Imposing a binding price ceiling

• Proposal <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>: Granting a per-unit subsidy to consumers

(i) Compared to the market equilibrium in part (a), would the deadweight loss increase, decrease, or remain the same under Proposal <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>I</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>? Explain.

(ii) Compared to the market equilibrium in part (a), would the quantity produced increase, decrease, or remain the same under Proposal <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>II</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>? Explain.
